summary: In this context, nitrate and superoxides are indirectly related through their roles in the biochemical pathways involving nitric oxide (NO) generation and oxidative stress. The text discusses how elevated oxygen levels during hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBO2) may lead to the oxidation of nitrite to nitrate, potentially mediated by reactive oxygen species like superoxide. This suggests a complex interplay where superoxides may influence nitrate levels through oxidative reactions, although the specific relationship is not deeply explored.
